(football team)|Galatasaray]] | team1association = | team1score = 0 | team2 = [[BeÅiktaÅ J.K.|BeÅiktaÅ]] | team2association = | team2score = 1 | date = July 30, 2006 | stadium = [[Commerzbank Arena]] | city = [[Frankfurt]] | man_of_the_match1a = [[Mert Nobre]] ([[BeÅiktaÅ J.K.|BeÅiktaÅ]]) | referee = [[BÃ¼lent Demirlek]] ([[Turkish Football Federation|Turkey]]) | attendance = | weather = | previous = [[1998 Presidential Cup|1998]] | next = [[Turkish Super Cup 2007|2007]] }} The '''2006 Turkish Super Cup''' was a [[Football (Soccer)|football]] match between the [[Turkish Super League]] Champion, [[Galatasaray S.K. (football team)|Galatasaray S.K.]], and the [[Turkish Cup]] Champion, [[BeÅiktaÅ J.K.]]. The match was played in [[Frankfurt]], Germany. It was the 34th edition the [[Turkish Super Cup]] since its establishment, and its under the name ''' TFF SÃ¼per Kupa'''. ==Galatasaray S.K.== Galatasaray won their 16th Turkish Super League championship with 26 wins, 5 draws and 3 losses. Galatasaray beat BeÅiktaÅ at home 3â2, and away 2â1. With 83 points they became the champion. ==BeÅiktaÅ J.K.== BeÅiktaÅ finished third in the Super League, but won their 6th Turkish Cup. In the group stage, BeÅiktaÅ finished 2nd place behind [[Samsunspor]]. In the Quarterfinals, BeÅiktaÅ beat [[Kayserispor]] 2â0 at home and lost 1â0 away. BeÅiktaÅ beat [[Gaziantepspor]] 3â1 at home, and 2â0 away.
